reviewText:
This is a fun enough game to play - it delivers what the store page claims. You are having a tea party with a stuffed animal (Ted), who demands certain items be dropped in front of him. You just go down the list. There are like five different environments.

Pros:
+It gets laughs just like Surgeon Simulator did
+You can actually walk quite a bit around the area now

Cons:
-Regretfully, I didn't realize until after I purchased this, that this game is not made by the same developers that did Surgeon Simulator, which is fine except they totally rip off the game style (same font, idea, and graphical style)
-There is alot to interact with, but I feel there could be more. For example, there are many items/cabinets/handles on the fringes of the rooms that look interactable, but are not
-Only five environments, as I have heard (I have witnessed two)
-Price is steep for what it is


Overall, it was fun, but I certainly won't get anywhere near 10 hours out of this. I was on the fence about the 'no' vote - but this is fair warning so my Steam friends know what they are getting into. This does not have the content of Goat Simulator. I suppose the cheap laughs might be worth it if it is on deep discount.

I think I'll call it a day on this game and go elsewhere.

reviewText:
The game was fun for a couple of minutes when you just start out, playing for the sake of laughs. If for any reason you actually want to progress however, the wonky physics and terrible controls will make you rage like no other. God forbid if you wanted to complete the achievements, cause it will redefine the meaning of frustration for you, personally.

The placement of tea sets and cutleries are random by default, so it is possible to begin with an impossible setup. Lucky, you can turn that off in the options. On the other hand, the wobble in the plane stage, the low gravity effects in the space stage and the rain of fruits in the wonderland stage are fairly random in their impact. That my friends, cannot be adjusted in the options. Thus it is always best to pray while you play, since there are no skills here, just luck and RNG.

Iâ€™ll give you an honest opinion, the game is badly made and the content is bare bones, it is nowhere near the worth of its asking price. Please donâ€™t fall for the â€œoh-so-funnyâ€ reviews, you can do a lot better with your hard earned money.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Provided Giveaways Reborn !
If you have some extra coin in the budget and enjoy riding the wave of simulator games that came out in 2015, you may enjoy this game. If, however, you are looking for something other than basic monotonous gameplay with some funny one-laugh achievements, move on.

PresentationThe game itself looks really nice for the asking price. Running the game on fantastic the arm is actually very well rendered, and reminds me of the renderings presented by some AAA (big title) games. But that is when the graphics stop being â€œfantastic. Most of the objects in the game are made of 1-2 colors. It almost looks like the developer attempted a cell-shaded graphics style and failed. The music changes level to level
date: but on each level is just a trill that lasts around 10 seconds and constantly repeats.\n\nInterface/ControlsThe game is limited in its technical settings: you can set up the graphics and controls before entering the game
hoursPlayed: if you want to change anything again
voteText: you will actually need to exit before doing so and use the pre-game console again.\n\nPlotThe plot this game offers is very minimal
helpfulPercent: and may not even be able to be given the title â€œplot.â€ The different levels of the game are effectively simple map changes
votesTotal: while they do parody some elements of pop culture
votesFunny: they become monotonous and boring. The Teddy bear that you are tasked with giving tea to does have some funny one-liners
commentsCount: but then repeats them several times in the span of one map.\n\nGameplayTo sum this game in one sentence: fun for the first couple minutes until you realize that you are doing the same action for the rest of the game with no variation in its mechanics. None of the elements change at all. For each level you are tasked with doing the same exact thing repeatedly. You have the exact same mission in every map: get the tea
column19: and biscuit. The first level was a little entertaining
column20: but the game quickly became a chore to be completed and not an enjoyable nor compelling experience.\n\nReplayabilityI might play this game again only to get the Steam achievements as they deliver some more relatively funny one-liner jokes by the Teddy Bear character. Other than that
column21: this game is almost the first level copy and pasted 5 more times.\n\nConclusionThe game offers a challenge
column23: to both master the controls and be able to eloquently and literally set a table. In the end it is hard to recommend this game. Some were lucky enough to receive this game for free
column24:
but those that have to pay the asking price will be sorely disappointed.

reviewText:
Review on Tea Party Simulator 2015
Written by Rias Gremory

ProsThis game has Jelly, and a lot of tea. This game has some awkward controls, but yet it can still be fun, due to the lack of control you have over your player. I enjoyed playing this, it was very weird, but I learnt that it was possible and you can have yourself a bit of fun, by playing with Jelly, and a teddy bear, maybe even some cake! I do not seem to envy this game, but instead I can sit back and play this as a comedy game, or possibly even a competitive game.

ConsThis game can be very frustrating, and can be extremely pathetic at times, due to the confusing controls, and the weird objectives. I can play this game, yet I cannot seem to work out what the point of this is? Personally I wouldn't take this game seriously if I was you, but instead just as a weird type of â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ game. I hope you can responsibly tolerate my review, but this is my honest review.

Overall reviewThe game itself is unique I agree, but I don't want to play this game for longer than 10 hours, I don't think my brain could take it, I can play this game respectively, and I can enjoy the physics (Not A very serious game at all) I can recommend this game only to those who can make content on YouTube following your genre of games, or if you just want to have a laugh while you have free-time.

This was a short review I know but there wasn't really much you can comment on this game.

Extra InformationDeveloper(s): Liens, Power Up to Maximum
Publisher(s): Liens , Power Up to Maximum
Platform(s): Windows
Release Date: April 23rd 2015

SourcesPersonal Experience
Steam Store Page
Wikipedia

Written for 11th Floor 11th Floor Group

reviewText:
Dear Sir or Madame,
I am much obliged that you are interested in this Tea Party Simulator. In virtue of my empirical knowledge of computerised amusement I arrive at the conclusion, that this dalliance is actually quite marvellous!

It is indeed a delightful divertissement of one's everyday world.
My most dearly beloved thing about it was that cathartic gratification when you vandalise the whole dining table.

The only circumstance which afflicted my extraordinary experience of having tea time was the fact,

THAT I DID't KNOW WHAT DO TO AT ALL!!

Splendidly it was gratuitous...

Yours faithfully


ElZorro

reviewText:
Tea Party Simulator 2015â„¢
Overview
Tea Party Simulator 2015â„¢ is a new '  random table  ' game.
In Tea Party Simulator 2015â„¢ you are preparing tea for your teddy, but it's not so easy as it sounds it is, it's very likely that you would knock down cups, teapots, cakes and other stuff.
This game  contains 28 steam achievements, one of the achievement you just get when you break everything and smash everything to the ground and in the air.
As they say, practice makes perfect, and this â€“ together with a great deal of patience â€“ is precisely what you need to move from level to level in this game.
You only play with a left hand, and that's all you are allowed to use to make tea, server cake slices, cookies and more.
if you fail, and everyone fails at least once, you can restart the mission, everytime you restart, there will be a different table layout, unless you turn that option off.
I have read there are a few easter-eggs, but I couldn't find one yet.
Tea Party Simulator 2015â„¢ looks like Surgeon Simulator, but now you doesn't have to operate somebody.

In my opinion
This game is fun to play, but in my opinion the price is a bit to high, maybe because it's a new game?
The game is a bit like Surgeon Simulator, you have to do everything with one hand, what makes the game funny, but if you fails over and over the game gets a bit tedious.
I would recommend this game if you like simulators with a lot of funny things.

Pros & Cons

+ Pros
+ It's  very funny game to play.
+ The graphics are really nice, you can play on beautiful so it's looks more real (even you play with only a left hand).
+ Cool environments. (The beach, Airplane, more)

- Cons
- It's a pricy game, I got it as a gift.
- The boards, cups, breakes really fast. (the mission was loaded and everything was already broken in the plane)

Rating
I liked to play this game so I give it a 7, It's a nice game with several missions.
The graphics are really good, even if you got a bad computer you can play this game on medium or low, but if you got a good pc, you can play this game on beatiful.

If you found this review helpful and want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group:  Follow here!

reviewText:
Surgeon Simulator was at least fun to play. This isn't. The whole point of the game is to grab a few objects and throw them in front of a teddy bear without the plates or cups breaking, which is really hard to do because there will always be a lot of other stuff on the table in the way and if you try to move those out of the way you will end up messing the whole table up.

The second level is nearly impossible to finish because everything spawns in random places everytime and most of the time stuff just breaks and flies somewhere you can't reach it.

The game is obviously made so that youtubers like Pewdiepie or Markiplier can get some nice views cuz the game is lol so randum XDD" and it's definitely a waste of 10eur if you bought it. And if you got it for free
date: like most of the people probably did
recommended: at least you will make some profit from the trading cards."

reviewText:
My wife gave me a choice, this or Fallout 4. I believe I made the right choice.

In all seriousness, I'm very happy they finally got VR into this game. I've been looking for a good Tea Party Simulator, for ages now, and that the reality of such a game would coincide with the emergence of virtual reality, that's just the icing on the cake.

Speaking of cake, there's cake in tihs game. You can even use a knife to cut the cake and give it to your best teddy bear friend. Or you could use the knife to cut your teddy bear friend and serve it to the cake, which is what I did, naturally.

I poured scalding hot water all over the crotch of the teddy bear, but I said it was an accident, so it was ok. Then I found a treasure chest with some sunglasses, so I threw the table at the teddy bear, because reasons.

I find this game really lets me express my inner princess, with a kind of psychopathic charm that I've always longed for.

Thanks to Tea Party Simulator, I CAN have my cake and virtually eat it, too.

reviewText: As a mature adult, and avid gamer, I tend to stay away from these â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥, useless Youtuber Bait Games
date:
like Goat Simulator, I am Bread and other idiocies that have no place in a gamer's library who respects him/herself, but I needed something quick and casual that I could play for a minute or two to get my mind distracted.

I refused to get this thing but after someone insisted, I gave it a try. It's really not that bad and it is actually playable with a considerable amount of skill required without being purposely impossible. I actually like it as a little casual game.

Only cons: too expensive. Shouldn't be more than 3 bucks, in my opinion.

reviewText: After attempting to play this game for what feels like an eternity, I can honestly say it's not worth it. I don't know how it managed to get a 'mostly positive' score on here. If you were going into this expecting something like surgeon simulator (as I was), don't waste your money. The controls are even worse, the physics (hahah hah hah hahah) are outrageous and random, and some levels feel utterly impossible (such as trying to serve tea IN a turbulance-infested airplane).\n\n1/10 for a game that functions, but extremely poorly.

With 100% accuracy and 100% precision, I landed a splendid amount of hot and sweet tea to THE â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ING TEDDY BEAR THAT KILLED ME AT LEAST 50 TIMES DURING THE GAME!
.
69/10 would bath tea to the teddy bear again.
